cards.title: Sudan landslide kills at least 1,000 people, rebel group says
cards.summary: The landslide destroyed the village of Tarasin in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivor. The Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM) appealed to the UN and international aid agencies to help recover the bodies. The SLM has mostly stayed out of the fighting but controls parts of Sudan’s tallest mountain range.

cards.title: Painting looted by Nazis recovered in Argentina
cards.summary: Portrait of a Lady, by Italian master Giuseppe Ghislandi, had been missing for 80 years. It was spotted last month on an estate agent's website, where a photo showed it hanging in a house that had belonged to the daughter of a Nazi fugitive. Patricia Kadgien's late father Friedrich had been a top adviser to Hermann Goring, Adolf Hitler's deputy, who plundered thousands of works from across Europe.

cards.title: Hot mic catches Putin and Xi discussing organ transplants and immortality
cards.summary: Vladimir Putin was in Beijing with Chinese leader Xi Jinping for a military parade. State media aired live footage that captured parts of what appeared to be a private conversation. Putin’s interpreter could be heard saying in Chinese: “Biotechnology is continuously developing” After a brief inaudible passage, the interpreter added: ‘The longer you live, the younger you become, and [you can] even achieve immortality’
